alert.note: Alert for Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 28 at 6:09AM AKST until December 30 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow occuring. Freezing rain possible. Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Total snow accumulations 12 inches, are expected. Freezing rain possible from Fairbanks south this evening with a light glaze possible. West winds gusting to 35 mph expected from midnight tonight through Wednesday evening. * WHERE...Middle Tanana Valley. * WHEN...Midnight to 6 AM Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Look for significant reductions in visibility at times. Two inches of snow have occurred between midnight and 6am, and another 3 inches is expected through noon today. Snow is expected to become light this afternoon, then become heavy by early this evening and remain heavy tonight. There is a chance of light freezing rain this evening as well. Several more inches of snow are expected on Thursday. West winds gusting to 35 mph are expected from midnight tonight through Wednesday evening and will cause blowing snow with reduced visibility. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet and ice are occurring. This will make travel very difficult or impossible. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
